meanings.definition: A form of government in which all members have equal power and authority.
meanings.sent1: The small community practiced pantisocracy, where every person had an equal say in decision-making.
meanings.sent2: The idea of pantisocracy was appealing to those who believed in fairness and equality in governance.
meanings.sent3: In the land of pantisocracy, even the youngest member had a vote in important matters.
meanings.sent4: The concept of pantisocracy can be like a symphony, with each individual playing a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The image of pantisocracy is like a colorful mosaic, with each piece contributing to the whole.

meanings.definition: A utopian society in which all individuals are equal and share in governing.
meanings.sent1: The dreamers envisioned a pantisocracy where everyone lived in harmony and cooperation.
meanings.sent2: The idea of a pantisocracy where all individuals had a voice in decision-making was inspiring.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the characters created a pantisocracy where even animals had a say in ruling.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted a picture of a pantisocracy where diversity was celebrated and embraced.
meanings.sent5: The concept of pantisocracy is like a garden where every flower contributes to the beauty of the whole.
